contentrichtext.text: {{coord|35.707327|N|139.774847|E|display=title}} {{Infobox Japan station |namerom = Okachimachi |name = 御徒町 |image = Okachimachi-station-2005-06.jpg |imagesize = 300px |caption = |pref = Tokyo |city = |ward = Taitō |address = 5 Ueno |jaloc = 東京都台東区上野５丁目 |postal = |open = 1925 |close = |oldname = |presentname = |station_number = |operator = [[JR East]] |line = [[Yamanote Line]], [[Keihin-Tōhoku Line]] |stats = 68,402 |statsnote = (FY2011) |bus = }} {{nihongo|'''Okachimachi Station'''|御徒町駅|Okachimachi-eki}} is a railway station in [[Taito, Tokyo]], Japan, operated by [[East Japan Railway Company]] (JR East).<ref name="jreast">{{cite web |url= http://www.jreast.co.jp/estation/station/info.aspx?StationCd=355|title= 各駅情報（御徒町駅）|trans_title=Station Information (Okachimachi Station) |publisher= East Japan Railway Company|location= Japan|language= Japanese|archiveurl= |archivedate= |accessdate= 19 July 2012}}</ref> ==Lines== Okachimachi Station is served by the circular [[Yamanote Line]] and also the [[Keihin-Tōhoku Line]]. Although not physically connected, {{Ja-stalink|Naka-Okachimachi}} on the [[Tokyo Metro Hibiya Line]], {{Ja-stalink|Ueno-hirokōji}} on the [[Tokyo Metro Ginza Line]], and {{Ja-stalink|Ueno-okachimachi}} on the [[Toei Ōedo Line]] are within walking distance of Okachimachi and marked as interchanges on route maps. ==Station layout== The station is on a raised viaduct running in a roughly north-south direction. There are two island platforms with two tracks on either side of each platform. Platforms 1 and 4 (the outermost tracks) serve the Keihin-Tōhoku Line, while platforms 2 and 3 (the inner tracks) are used for [[Yamanote Line]] trains.<ref name="layout">[http://www.jreast.co.jp/e/stations/e355.html Okachimachi station layout] ''JR East'' Retrieved 2009-01-11</ref> This platform arrangement allows for easy [[cross-platform interchange]]s so that passengers may transfer between lines in the same direction by walking across the platform. East of the platforms are tracks belonging to the [[Tōhoku Main Line]] formerly running to [[Tokyo Station]] but which are now used to stable trains terminating at [[Ueno Station]]. ==Platforms== {{ja-rail-line|pfn=1|first=2|name=Keihin-Tōhoku Line|col=deepskyblue|dir=for {{Ja-stalink|Tokyo}}, {{Ja-stalink|Yokohama}}, and {{Ja-stalink|Ōfuna}}}} {{ja-rail-line|pfn=2|name=Yamanote Line|col=yellowgreen|dir=for {{Ja-stalink|Tokyo}} and {{Ja-stalink|Shinagawa}}}} {{ja-rail-line|pfn=3|nidx=Yamanote Line|col=yellowgreen|dir=for {{Ja-stalink|Ueno}} and {{Ja-stalink|Ikebukuro}}}} {{ja-rail-line|pfn=4|first=3|nidx=Keihin-Tōhoku Line|col=deepskyblue|dir=for {{Ja-stalink|Ueno}}, {{Ja-stalink|Akabane}}, and {{Ja-stalink|Ōmiya||Saitama}}}} Okachimachi has two exits, the {{Nihongo|north exit|北口}} and {{Nihongo|south exit|南口}}.<ref name="layout"/> Both exits have ticket vending machines and toilets; however, the north exit has a JR reservation office and escalators to the platforms. Luggage lockers are available at the south exit.<ref name="layout"/> ==Adjacent stations== {{j-railservice start}} {{j-route|route=Yamanote Line|col=yellowgreen}} {{j-rserv|previous={{ja-stalink|Akihabara}}|next={{ja-stalink|Ueno}}|service=-}} {{j-route|route=Keihin-Tōhoku Line|col=deepskyblue}} {{j-rserv|service=Local|col=deepskyblue|previous=Akihabara|next=Ueno}} {{j-rserv|p|service=Rapid}} {{s-end}} ==History== The station opened on 1 November 1925.<ref name="jreast"/> ==Passenger statistics== In fiscal 2011, the station was used by an average of 68,402 passengers daily (boarding passengers only).<ref name="jreast2011stats">{{cite web |url= http://www.jreast.co.jp/passenger/index.html|title= 各駅の乗車人員 (2011年度)|trans_title= FY2011 Station passenger figures|publisher= East Japan Railway Company|location= Japan|language= Japanese|archiveurl= |archivedate= |accessdate= 19 July 2012}}</ref> ==Surrounding area== Okachimachi Station is in the centre of a busy commercial district stretching southwards from Ueno Station. Particularly well-known is [[Ameya-Yokochō]] ("Ameyoko"), a busy shopping street dominated by small market-style stalls selling a wide variety of wares. Ameyoko runs parallel to the railway line and includes a large market under the railway tracks. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category}} * [http://www.jreast.co.jp/estation/station/info.aspx?StationCd=355 Okachimachi Station information] {{ja icon}} {{Yamanote Line}} {{Keihin-Tōhoku Line Negishi Line}} [[Category:Yamanote Line]] [[Category:Keihin-Tōhoku Line]] [[Category:Stations of East Japan Railway Company]] [[Category:Railway stations in Tokyo]]
